import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as py
import plotly.offline
# date and time
import datetime as date

pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None)
pd.set_option('display.max_row', None)
import plotly as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go
from plotly.offline import iplot, init_notebook_mode
import bar_chart_race as bcr


import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# Rename date
data.rename(columns={'Unnamed: 0':'date'}, inplace=True)
# change object into date and time formet 
data['date']=pd.to_datetime(data['date'])
long['Dates']=pd.to_datetime(long['Dates'])
data_copy=data.copy()   

# Reset index value 
data.set_index('date',inplace=True)
source.cf54e9c5: bcr.bar_chart_race(data, figsize=(7, 4),period_length =500,filename = None, title='power usage by states')
source.6ff986b2:
# data cleaning 
data['Total']=data.sum(axis=1)
data.loc['Total']=data.sum()
Total_comsumes=data.iloc[[-1]]
Total=Total_comsumes.transpose()
Total.drop(Total.index[[-1]], inplace=True)
Total.reset_index(inplace=True)
Total.rename(columns={'index':'State'}, inplace=True)
source.426dcef6:
# Bar chart of state wise electricity consumption
fig=go.Figure(go.Pie(labels=Total['State'], 
                     values=Total['Total'], title='State Wise Electricity Consumption'))
iplot(fig)
source.61a99259:

Top_10_EC_Consume

cons=go.Bar(x=Top_10_EC_Consume['Total'], y=Top_10_EC_Consume['State'], orientation='h' )
fig=go.Figure(data=cons, layout=layout)

print(Top_10_EC_Consume)

source.64ce3ab9:
data_resample['NR'] = data_resample['Punjab']+ data_resample['Haryana']+ data_resample['Rajasthan']+ data_resample['Delhi']+data_resample['UP']+data_resample['Uttarakhand']+data_resample['HP']+data_resample['J&K']+data_resample['Chandigarh']

data_resample['WR'] = data_resample['Chhattisgarh']+data_resample['Gujarat']+data_resample['MP']+data_resample['Maharashtra']+data_resample['Goa']+data_resample['DNH']

data_resample['SR'] = data_resample['Andhra Pradesh']+data_resample['Telangana']+data_resample['Karnataka']+data_resample['Kerala']+data_resample['Tamil Nadu']+data_resample['Pondy']

data_resample['ER'] = data_resample['Bihar']+data_resample['Jharkhand']+ data_resample['Odisha']+data_resample['West Bengal']+data_resample['Sikkim']

data_resample['NER'] =data_resample['Arunachal Pradesh']+data_resample['Assam']+data_resample['Manipur']+data_resample['Meghalaya']+data_resample['Mizoram']+data_resample['Nagaland']+data_resample['Tripura']

fig=go.Figure()

                        mode='lines',
                        name='NR'))

                        mode='lines',
                        name='WR'))
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=data_resample['date'], y=data_resample['SR'],
                        mode='lines',
                        name='SR'))
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=data_resample['date'], y=data_resample['ER'],
                        mode='lines',
                        name='ER'))
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=data_resample['date'], y=data_resample['NER'],
                        mode='lines',
                        name='NER'))
fig.update_layout(title='Regine wise Power Electricity Consumption')
iplot(fig)

source.190ea734:
overall before corona Maharashtra consume maximum Electricity (above 400) in time Electricity consume is less then a 300.
in Gujarat pandemic time electricity consumption is decressing
last year april "UP" electricity consumption is less than a 300 but in corona time Electricity consume is extremely incressing comparatively other state (above 400)
In corona Tamil Nadu consume maximum electricityelectricity comparatively last year
in corona time punjab and West Bengal consume high electricity comparatively last year
source.3888000d:
- In totaly Maharashtra state consume 12.7% power
- Gujarat  state consume 9.5% power 
- South states consume 5% to within 10% Electric city in india
source.fa4e642f:
* In North regine UP consume maximum electricity
* Chandigrah Consume low electricity in nothregine
* In strating of jun every NR states started decline in consumption.
* Again middle of july started rise in electricity comsumption.
source.96570334: sikkim is very lowest ec comption state
source.e6449fc7: over all North Regine consum high Elecrtricity 27.3% North east regine Electricity Consumption in 21.2 % South Regine and West Regine consum allmost same Electricity 18.2 East Regine consume minimum Electricity 15.2
source.41b5dce1:
- In South regine Tamil Nadu state comsume maximum power and Pondy consume minimun electricity.
- comparatively last year to this year April  decline the electricity compution because of lockdown time
source.526e2339:
* in this pandemic time over all Regines Electricity Consumption is decreasing comparatively last year.
* in all Regine, when the summer is starting that time the usage of Electricity is started incressing middle of February the power usage started incressing.
* in Jun month usage of power is started decressing agine July month started incressing power usage
* October and November are usually cloudless so that time the usage of Electricity is low.
source.16402d0d:
- In West Regine Maharashtra State consume maximum electricity.
- last year the power consume is Middle of Feb is started incressing and Jun month decressing the power consumption 
- Againe july middle started incressing the power consumption 
- All the states the pandemic time decressing the power consumption.
